forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a delicate hush envelops the city, the air thick with a sense of possibility. The gentle drizzle predicted meets the early light, casting a softened glow on the streets below. Currently resting at a cool 54 degrees, the day begins under a blanket of dusky clouds that promise a slight chance of drizzle throughout the morning, giving the already iconic streets a glistening sheen that almost enhances their charm. Look closely, and you might catch the outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge gradually emerging through the shroud, the marine layer hanging low, susceptible to the light breeze whispering from the west.

As the hours unfurl, expect a gradual warming to around 65, the tenuous clouds yielding to patches of sunlight that will flirt with the coolness of the air. Winds will gently sway with a refreshing motion, coaxing a sense of adventure for those willing to embrace the city’s raw, rugged beauty. For the discerning urbanite, dressing in layers will be essential—think a light jacket over soft knits, comfortable enough to enjoy a stroll down to the waterfront or perhaps a casual café outing, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee dances amidst conversations. Given the weather and time, the city calls for quiet explorations of local art galleries or hidden bookstores, where one can lose themselves in the pages between the reality beyond. Today, your surroundings may feel as though they carry the weight of stories waiting to be unveiled, and it is worth every moment to linger in their embrace.
